content.description:
Start with the first two clips of

Prowler

and move left after the second bolt. The crux is getting past the 4th bolt. Watch your dog, however. Dogging the crux will make it seem easier, but keep the sequence and it may seem tricky for the grade. The route was actually named after the dog from the house just downstream that got picked off by the big cat in the spring of 2012.
content.protection: Half a dozen draws and something for the double bolt rap at the top. The last clip was placed to guide the rope around a snag on the ledge above, so it is best to clip it.
content.location: This is the middle of three routes.

content.description:
Natural History teaches that when a big cat makes a kill it is often via a powerful, accurate, focused strike to back of the neck, severing the cervical spinal cord. This seems about right for the crux sequence on The Strike.

The Strike begins on the left overhang. Power up to a rail system and swim out right to the arete. The first crux comes in standing up at clip four. Moving past clip five is the technical crux and entails a number of tricky and powerful moves. The crux ends when you stand above clip six. Bolts above guide the rope away from snags on the ledge.
content.protection: Eight draws and something for the double bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: This is the left of three routes on the block.

content.description:
This is a fun, warm-up boulder problem before the sport climbing routes. Start deeper in the cave right under the sport route

Prowlers'

starting point.
content.location:
Start lower in the cave of Mill Creek Block on the right side of the overhang. An easy way to find it is the start of sport route

Prowler

, and go deeper inside closer to the middle of the cave next to a pointed rock on your left.

End on the left the first quickdraw.

Safety note: bring 2-3 pads, there are some pointy rocks under you.

content.description: This is a slightly technical boulder problem that moves to the right of the overhang with a nice swing and pump connecting into the overhangs lip under the first bolt.
content.location:
Start right under first bolt of

Prowler

with a toe hook/bicycle and your left hand on a good jug. Move right up to good jugs and crimps. This endis in the lip of

Prowler

just below the first bolt.

Watch your head on the rocks below.

content.description: Pull out of the cave on jugs and zip up on more great stone. It is a tad pumpy for the grade. The first two clips are shared with the route immediately left.
content.protection: Half a dozen draws and something for the double bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: This is the right-most of three routes.

content.description:
Start on the beginning of

The Strike

, sharing the first bolt. Power straight up a steep series of jugs, pinches, laybacks, and gastons to a quick shake. Crimp your way into the scoop, rest up, and transition into a technical series up and right to the ledge just below the anchors. Cruise to the two-bolt anchor at the top of the

Strik

e arête. It is highly recommended to hang a double slung draw on bolt three to clip that bolt from lower holds. Otherwise, bring an attentive belayer for the lower section. This may feel easier if you can reach through some powerful sections.

The lower section of the route is in the shade throughout the day, but the top does see some sun.
content.location:
This starts in the same place as

The Strike

, climber's right of El Gato Monte (SW face of the block).

content.description:
This is a short but stout route, which essentially amounts to a roped bouldering problem. I'm settling at a V4, shouldery crux.

Start with some stiff moves off the block, and gain a decent clipping ledge for bolt 2. Decipher the powerful crux, and continue on dynamic 5.11- climbing to bolt 4. A couple careful moves will bring you over the ledge to the anchors. I've scraped a bunch of lichen from the moves to the anchors, but it's still a tad dirty on the final (easier) moves.

This route faces SW and gets afternoon sun in the summer. All other routes on the block will be in the shade at this time.
content.location:
This ascends the SW corner of the Mill Creek Block, to the left of

The Strike

.
